oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ambrotype of Pvt. Charles E. Sneed
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Sneed was from Rutherford County, Tenn., and enlisted on Nov. 26, 1861, in Nashville. He served in Co. F, 4th (Starnes'-McClemore's) Tenn. Cav. Regt., also known as "The Williamson County Cavalry." In 1862, they reported to Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest, and fought at Parker's Crossroads and Thompson's Station. Sneed served until February 25, 1865.
